Model

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is initiated when starting a new game and creates the logical structure of the map and its objects. It is also the core of all the in-game logical functions.
    Version:
    2015-03-03
    Author:
    Martin Greer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameLogic(int mapNr, int playerNr)
      Constructor that will read a map text file and, if it exists, a saved player object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic(int mapNr,
                 int playerNr)
        Constructor that will read a map text file and, if it exists, a saved player object. Creates a new player with base stats if a save file does not exist. The player always spawns on a default tile on game start (top left corner).
        Parameters:
        mapNr - The ID of the map that the player selected.
        playerNr - The ID of the chosen player character.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save(int playerId)
        Saves the current state of the player object into a local file on the users file system. This function is only called when a map is completed by walking through the open door.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The ID of the player character to be saved.

      • load

        public void load(int playerId)
        Attempts to load a player state from a local file and puts those values into the current player object. This function is only called upon map creation.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The ID of the player character to be loaded.

      • pressedKey

        public void pressedKey(java.lang.String key)
        Registers which direction the player wants to go next and calls the function that decides which action to perform for the next tile.
        Parameters:
        key - The key that was pressed.

      • getCurrentEnemy

        public Enemy getCurrentEnemy()
        Getter for the current enemy that the player is interacting with.
        Returns:
        The current enemy as an Enemy object.

      • getTiles

        public Tile[][] getTiles()
        Getter for the tiles array.
        Returns:
        The tiles array.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Getter for the player character.
        Returns:
        The player as a Player object.

      • openFile

        public void openFile()
        Opens the map framework file that matches the map choice in the Choose Map menu.

      • readFile

        public void readFile()
        Reads the opened map file and creates the logical two-dimensional record of which static objects exist on each tile.

      • closeFile

        public void closeFile()
        Closes the file.

      • discoverDarkness

        public void discoverDarkness()
        Gives visibility to each tile in a "diamond" shape around the player. This will remove the darkness layer from those tiles that is initially painted over the whole map.

      • decideAction

        public void decideAction(Tile nextTile)
        Decides which action to perform depending on which interactive object exists on the next tile the player wants to move to. If no interactive object exists there, attempt to move the player to the tile.
        Parameters:
        nextTile - The tile that the player is trying to move to.

      • fight

        public void fight(Tile nextTile)
        This function is called when an enemy exists on the next tile. The player will fight with the enemy and their stats will be used to reduce HP etc. A random number generator is used to play different punching sounds. Here it's also checked if either the enemy and player have zero or negative HP, which means it's being killed and the appropriate actions are taken. Every time an enemy is killed, we check if all the enemies are dead with a function call and if the function returns true, the variable that keeps track of this is also set to true and the "open door" sound is played.
        Parameters:
        nextTile - The tile that the player is trying to move to.

      • pickUpItem

        public void pickUpItem(Item item)
        This function is called when the player collides with an item on the screen. colliding with the item gives the player new stats depending on what item was picked up.y
        Parameters:
        item - The item the player interacts with.

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(Tile nextTile)
        This function is called when the player collides with an item on the screen. Colliding with the items will remove it from the map. Depending on what item is removed a different sound will play.
        Parameters:
        nextTile - The tile that the player is trying to move to.

      • spawnObjectsInitiator

        public void spawnObjectsInitiator(int difficulty)
        This function calls the spawnObjectsRandomly() function to spawn objects on the map depending on what difficulty level the map has.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - The difficulty of the selected map

      • spawnEnemy

        public void spawnEnemy(int xPos,
                       int yPos,
                       java.lang.String enemyType)
        This function sets different tiles to spawn enemies on if the tiles are empty. Different types of enemies are spawned. The attack, health and damage is decided in this function.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x-position of the enemy.
        yPos - The y-position of the enemy.
        enemyType - The type of enemy.

      • spawnItem

        public void spawnItem(int xPos,
                      int yPos,
                      java.lang.String itemType)
        This function spawn different kinds of items on tiles if they are empty. The attack, health and damage of the item is the decided in this function.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x-position of the item.
        yPos - the y-position of the item.
        itemType - what kind of item is spawned.

      • spawnObjectsRandomly

        public void spawnObjectsRandomly(java.lang.String type,
                                 int amount)
        This function chooses empty tiles randomly to spawn objects on.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object is spawned.
        amount - The amount of objects to be spawned.

      • checkIfAllEnemiesAreDead

        public boolean checkIfAllEnemiesAreDead()
        Checks if there are no enemies the map, if so, opens the door.
        Returns:
        true if there is still an enemy on the map, otherwise false.
